home.title: Please tell us how you're feeling during this COVID-19 crisis

text.p1: This is an incredibly challenging time, and the pandemic has transformed our lives in ways we never could have imagined. We’re concerned about the health of our loved ones, grateful for the medical heroes and essential workers in our communities, and trying our best to adapt to this new normal. We want to be optimistic, but the ongoing stress and uncertainty is affecting us all, and it’s hard not to worry about what the future holds.
text.p2: We are here to listen and learn from your experience. We invite you to share your thoughts with us — including your fears, frustrations, and hopes — as an audio or video recording by clicking the "Share Your Thoughts" link above. Explore what others have recorded by clicking the "Listen to Others' Thoughts". If you choose to contribute your recording to science, it will help us find the best ways to provide support to families.
text.p3: The Child Mind Institute and Parents Magazine have partnered with the National Institute of Mental Health, OpenHumans.org, the CRI - Université de Paris, and Satrajit Ghosh and Sanu Abraham at MIT on this important research project.
text.p4: Pandemic Logger comes out of the MATTER Lab at the Child Mind Institute.
